intro: Humularia welwitschii var. lundaensis, commonly known as the Lunda lily, is a flowering plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy white flowers with a yellow center. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered berries that are edible. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
